title: Angelina Jolie cooks and eats tarantulas in Cambodia
text:
Angelina Jolie cooks and eats tarantulas in Cambodia Watch | Angelina Jolie cooks and eats tarantulas in Cambodia 00:33 21 February 2017 • 8:55am 
I f you want tips for getting over your ex, look to Angelina Jolie. 
The actress has been filmed cooking and eating spiders in Cambodia as part of promotion for her new film. 
In the video, she is seen preparing the delicacy and sharing it with the film cast and crew. 
"I think it's always been a part of the diet, the bugs," she explained. 
"But I think there is a truth to the survival during the war of course." Watch | Jolie on her divorce: we will always be a family 00:34 
S he continued: "When people were being starved they were able to survive on things like this and they did." 
The actress did this before she premiered her film, First They Killed My Father, a true-life account of the Khmer Rouge genocide through the eyes of a child. 
She told the BBC that she hopes the film will allow Cambodians to speak up about the genocide. 
The actress adopted her oldest son Maddox from the country in 2002. 
Jolie explained how she got a taste for the cuisine. "Crickets and a beer..and then you move up to tarantulas" #AngelinaJolie cooks bugs in #Cambodia with @BBCYaldaHakim . How was it Yalda?? https://t.co/IweyeKmifH — shaimaa khalil BBC (@Shaimaakhalil) February 20, 2017 
S he said: "Crickets, you start with crickets. 
"Crickets and a beer and then you kind of move up to tarantulas." 
Her children Vivienne and Knox bravely helped her prepare the unusual food. 
They even took some of the hot fried bugs; her daugher Shiloh was filmed biting into a freshly cooked spider. 
Jolie was then se en enjoying the crispy fried spider legs. 
She enthused: "It's actually really good, the flavour".
